abstract.text: Returns the next event matching a given mask.

inlineContent.text: The mask that the event to return must match. Events with non-matching masks are left in the queue. See
for the list of mask values.
The next event whose mask matches
when no matching event was found.
method, where the matching mask parameter is the specified

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
An object that manages an app’s main event loop and resources used by all of that app’s objects.
Removes all events matching the given mask and generated before the specified event.
Returns the next event matching a given mask, or
if no such event is found before a specified expiration date.
An object that contains information about an input action, such as a mouse click or a key press.
Constants that you use to filter out specific event types from the stream of incoming events.
The mode set when tracking events modally, such as a mouse-dragging loop.
A window that an app displays on the screen.
The event currently being processed by the application.
Forwards the message to the global application object.
Returns the next event matching a given mask.
Forwards the message to the global application object.
Forwards the message to the global application object.
This action method dispatches mouse and keyboard events the global application object sends to the window.
Dispatches action messages with a given argument.
A date object representing a date in the distant future.
A true value.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.

inlineContent.text: The mask that the event to return must match. Events with non-matching masks are left in the queue. See
for the list of mask values.
The next event whose mask matches
when no matching event was found.
